I200406180010

1. I started a fresh workspace using the following command line:
C:\eclipse\drops\eclipse>start eclipse.exe -showlocation -nosplash -vm C:\JavaSD
Ks\jdk1.4.2_03\bin\java -vmargs -showversion -Xms50M -Xmx350M -Dosgi.checkConfig
uration=true -verify

2. Clicked on the workbench icon (top right) and exited.

I'm pretty sure this is a warning message that can safely be ignored. At startup
the builder tries to initialize the rule factory extension in another thread,
and if the workbench is shutdown concurrently initialization of the extension
fails because the team bundle has been stopped by shutdown.

Moving to Core to confirm that this warning can be ignored.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 67706 ***

traces.message: The class "org.eclipse.team.internal.core.TeamHookDispatcher" cannot be loaded because the system is shutting down and the plug-in "org.eclipse.team.core" has already been stopped.
